context: The Finnish verb 'kuunnella' means 'to listen'. It is a transitive verb, meaning it requires an object (what you are listening to). The word originates from Proto-Finnic and has cognates in Hungarian.  It can also mean 'to eavesdrop' when used with the adverb 'salaa' (secretly). The form 'kuuntelen' means 'I listen', while 'kuuntelee' means 'he/she/it listens'. It is conjugated based on person and tense, as shown in the dictionary definition.
